page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This area of Cornwall is very beautiful with a peaceful atmosphere. This probably explains its popularity with tourists.Although during the Summer months it is a fairly busy area,there are still some visitors during the Winter months,because of the warm climate. The area is situated at the very end of the Roseland Peninsula and although it is a beautiful area in which to live,it is quite remote and transport and employment can be difficult. There is Virtually no industry in the region for this reason.Farming,fishing and tourism provide employment for most people who work within the region For those who live in the region and travel to the nearest towns of St.Austell and Truro,this means a journey of 18_20 miles.Also in the area there are a lot of retired people
